title: Policy Lab Senior Operations Manager
content:
About Elemental  
Elemental is a nonprofit investor in climate technologies with deep community impact. We bring more than a decade of experience across the climate sector, with an active and maturing portfolio of 150+ companies. Elemental fills two gaps fundamental to addressing climate change: funding projects for climate technologies in communities, and embedding equity and access into climate solutions. We invest in transformative technologies to create a system change for a more resilient, equitable future. 
With more than a decade of experience investing across many sectors and stages of climate technology, we have a maturing and active portfolio of 150+ companies, and a robust pipeline of thousands more. We invest deeply in entrepreneurs from traditionally excluded backgrounds and embed equity and access through every aspect of development through implementation. We heavily focus on project deployments that meaningfully bring in community input and deliver community impact. 
We do more than write a check; we find innovative and creative ways to identify and fill financing and support gaps in the market. Our wraparound support includes carbon finance, policy, equity and access coaching, corporate connections, diverse talent acquisition, follow on funding partnerships and beyond. 
About the Policy Lab
In April 2021, Elemental launched its Policy Lab to advance results-focused policy solutions at the nexus of climate tech innovation and social impact. The Policy Lab brings together policymakers, technology entrepreneurs, investors, and community leaders in collective action to motivate change where it is needed most. We do so by creating the building blocks for effective policy design and implementation—model policies and programs, toolkits, case studies, frameworks, and hands-on support—because it’s how solutions are deployed that ultimately delivers on the promise of policy and technology.
About the Role
Elemental is seeking a passionate self-starter to serve as a Policy Lab Senior Operations. This position will report to Elemental’s Managing Director, Policy and support our work and systems to help Elemental’s portfolio companies and key policy leaders scale climate solutions with deep community impact. The role will also work closely with our Senior Policy Advisor who leads our Policy Fellows program and with our Senior Manager of Portfolio Experience who supervises coaching and other supports for our portfolio companies. The role requires excellent collaboration skills, strong workflow management, strong execution and attention to detail, and ability to create and maintain systems that assess key trends and data to enable innovation and impact in our team’s work.
Key Responsibilities:

Design, run, and improve Policy Lab systems and infrastructure for tracking action items, workstream progress and team impact

Support Policy Lab budget management, invoice approvals, and contracting,
Lead outreach and engagement tracking systems for Policy Lab team, including ensuring contact lists are regularly updated for event invitations, campaigns, partner engagement, and other purposes,
Support team-wide objective and key results tracking related to portfolio company coaching and supports, partner relationships built, policymakers engaged, etc.

Support Policy Lab coordination and engagement across teams and externally with our policy partner ecosystem

Draft Policy Lab regular policy updates to post on key internal platforms,
Support scheduling as needed for larger internal or external Policy Lab meetings and offsites,
Coordinate with Elemental Events and Communications teams to develop outreach materials, support event coordination, and plan for quarterly DC gatherings and other Policy Lab events as needed.

Handle workflow to support portfolio company coaching engagements

Support coaching assignments to policy coaches and staff, ensure process compliance, and communicate status of engagements with portfolio team members,
Keep policy lab toolkit and other supports organized and up to date,
Support project management for new resource development, and
Support tracking of coaching outcomes and sharing with applicable team members.

Support Policy Fellows programming and operations

Lead operations to support recruitment and onboarding for new Fellows cohorts and interns to support Fellows projects (this coming Spring 2024 and on future 18 month cycles)
Support scheduling and coordinating of programming for Fellows monthly check-ins and engagement in organizational key events 1-2x per year, and
Support tracking of fellows' final work products and needs for support.

Other tasks and support, as needed and time allows

Support development of policy lab materials through collaborating with team on research and content development
Support internal communications and sharing of resources with team and the portfolio on organization platforms like Basecamp and Slack


About You
You could be a great addition to our team if you are:

Passionate about the intersection of technology, policy and social equity in underserved or underrepresented communities.
Energized by building out efficient internal operating systems and conducting multiple strands of fast-moving activity into a symphony of harmonious sound.
A problem solver and eager learner that’s curious about how we can track impact and results that help us support climate innovators and policymakers scale solutions.
Skilled at coordinating team workstreams and events that can inspire the climate tech ecosystem.
Want exposure to a broad array of projects on climate tech, government operations, innovative finance, and other emerging climate issues while others dive deep.

Qualifications
(even if you don’t meet 100% of qualifications, we still encourage you to apply!)
Desired Skills:

Experience developing and implementing processes, workflows, and tracking systems such as those related to portfolio company, policy, government and/or partner relation
Excellent project management and organization skills
Experience scheduling team meetings and offsites and planning and implementing events
Experience with policy, government, and partner landscape research
Flexible, creative, and comfortable in a fast-paced, evolving environment
High emotional intelligence and ability to build interpersonal relationships, including among remote team and staff
Excellent communication and coordination skills
Attention to detail
Experience with key tools such as Excel, Google Sheets, Airtable, and CRM systems

Standout Skills:

Worked in or studied climate and sustainability fields previously
Worked in the climate tech start up or investment field
Experience and knowledge of equity, justice, and community engagement issues and principles related to climate solutions
Experience writing and/or designing policy or government affairs materials

Compensation & Benefits
This is a full-time "at-will" position working at least 40 hours per week. 
The salary range for this role is $86,500-$140,100, which is based on market data and the organization's compensation philosophy. Individual salary offers will depend on and may vary with location, relevant education, knowledge, skills, and experience. We also offer comprehensive employee benefits, including a professional development stipend and three weeks paid time off (more details here).
Location
We will consider candidates located in the DMV (DC, Maryland, Virginia) area, as well as New York. We are asking employees to come into the office at least one day a week to build community with the team. Currently, most people come in 1-2 times a week, but we encourage those who are interested to come in more often if they’d like. If you are not within a reasonable distance to one of our offices, you may be expected to travel to our HQ offices on a quarterly basis, and other travel may sometimes be required for conferences or meetings.
Other Details
We will accept and review applications on a rolling basis. Although all applications will be considered, we may be unable to respond to all inquiries. Please note that we do read cover letters, so we advise spending adequate time on them to share your relevant stories and experiences with us. We also ask that you refrain from using tools like Chat GPT and keep the cover letter to 1-2 pages long. 
Elemental Excelerator is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and has a strong commitment to diversity. Candidates of all backgrounds are encouraged to apply. Candidates from the following groups are especially encouraged to apply: Black, Indigenous, and people of color (BIPOC); members of the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer or questioning, intersex, asexual (LGBTQIA+) communities; people who have disabilities; people from low-income backgrounds; people who identify as nonbinary; and women. Elemental is also committed to providing access and reasonable accommodation in its services, activities, programs, and employment opportunities in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act and other applicable laws.

demographic_questions.description:
Aloha,  

 

At Elemental, having a diverse organization that reflects the communities we partner with and serve is paramount to our mission to redesign systems at the root of our climate crisis. In order to increase representation across identity groups, we are collecting information regarding age, race/ethnicity, gender, and sexual orientation. We recognize these are not the only identities and are starting here as they are often the most salient for people in the workforce. Additionally, we want to make sure that all candidates receive fair treatment and have an equitable experience during the hiring process. Collecting demographic data will help us to identify trends and enhance the candidate experience. 

 

This survey is completely optional. Submitting information is 100% your choice. If you decide to share information with us, it will only be used to evaluate and support our Equity & Access efforts. Rest assured, this survey will have no influence on your application, interview process, or ultimately, hiring decision.  If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to us at Hiring@elementalexcelerator.com.
